c74object.name: the.jit.world~
c74object.digest: jit.world with offline rendering of realtime audiovisual content
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze Â© 2020, www.xenorama.com.
Additionally to all native jit.world functionality, performs and manages a linear offline rendering process frame-by-frame, hosted by the.jit.renderer~ internaly. When used in conjunction with other related objects, tight synchronisation of realtime MSP and other timing events can be rendered in high resolution and framerates, respectively.
c74object.discussion: It is an abstraction comprised of the.jit.renderer~ and jit.world and responds to both of these objects' documented attributes and methods.

objarg.name: render-context
objarg.digest: Specify a named render context for all children objects to sync to
objarg.description: Specify a named render context for all children objects to sync to.

objarg.name: settings-file
objarg.digest: Specify a previously exported settings-file in JSON-format
objarg.description: Provide a filename (.json) to import all previously saved attributes. If omitted, the.jit.renderer~ will launch with default settings or any supported attribute coded to the object box.

attribute.name: container
attribute.description: The final video can be either rendered as mov (default) or as img_seq. The latter requires an additional argument to specify the image format, i.e. the attribute or message container img_seq tiff will write successive frames to disk in tiff-format. Any previously saved image files will be overwritten and other ones ignored.

attribute.name: fps
attribute.digest: Specify a desired framerate for the final video.
attribute.description: The desired framerate (default: 30fps) needs to be set prior to beginning a render process and must not be changed throughout.

attribute.name: dim_render
attribute.digest: Specify a desired dimension (resolution) of the final video.
attribute.description:
The resolution of the final video need not be the current resolution but will change accordingly before beginning the render process. The initial dim of the world's render context will be re-established after rendering is complete.
The default render dim is 1280 x 960.

attribute.name: length
attribute.digest: Specify the length of the final video and all its subrecordings
attribute.description:
The word length followed by a floating point or integer value and a symbol specifying a unit, will prepare recording of all children objects for the given length.
Supported units of time are
ms
frames
samples
Default: length 1000. ms, if the current framerate is set to 30. (see also the fps listing), this would yield a length of 30 frames and would equal the current samplerate (provided in samples per minute = 1000ms.)

attribute.name: codec
attribute.description: Set movie codec for recording (default = h264).

attribute.name: fsaa
attribute.description:
Enable full scene anti-aliasing during offline rendering (default = 1). (This feature is deprecated)
This setting is temporary to the render process and will not override user settings of jit.world.
Deprecation Note: Since this setting requires subsequent enabling of any jit.gl.tf or new upload of any temporarily stored jit.gl.texture, this setting will no longer be supported and will have to be maintained by jit.world throughout its entire operation.

attribute.name: filename
attribute.digest: Provide a filename for all recorded files to assume
attribute.description:
Specify, which filename all generated files should assume when being written to the folder specified by the dir attribute. Objects operating in parallel (see the see also listing at the bottom of the reference page) will require an name to format their unique path additionally.
If omitted, the.jit.renderer~ uses the render-context as initial filename.

attribute.name: dir
attribute.digest: Full path to directory for all export data
attribute.description: The dir attribute specifies a valid path where audiofile, videofile, matrix-data and log-files will be saved to

attribute.name: autoreveal
attribute.digest: Open the directory upon render completion automatically
attribute.description: Open the directory upon render completion automatically

attribute.name: autoopen
attribute.digest: Open the videofile upon render completion automatically
attribute.description: Open the videofile upon render completion automatically

attribute.name: delaytime
attribute.description: Minimum delaytime between subsequent render bangs. The default is 10ms. Increase this value to reduce potential errors or lack of precision. This increases the length of the render process proportionally to the length of the videofile.

attribute.name: toggledsp
attribute.digest: Toggle DSP off during offline rendering
attribute.description:
Will disable DSP during video rendering process or a potential matrix capturing process and will restore previous DSP state upon render completion.
The default is 1 (toggle DSP off)

attribute.name: toggleworld
attribute.digest: Toggle jit.world off during audio or data recording
attribute.description:
Will disable jit.world rendering during audio or data recording and will reactivate it once recording has stopped.
The default is 1 (toggle video rendering off)

attribute.name: toggledsp
attribute.digest: Toggle DSP off during offline rendering
attribute.description:
Will disable DSP during video rendering process and restore to previous state upon render completion.
The default is 1 (toggle DSP off)

attribute.name: tf_support
attribute.digest: Support Transform Feedback using jit.gl.tf (no longer necessary)
attribute.description:
Support a render process including Transform Feedback on a jit.gl.mesh using jit.gl.tf. Essentially, it deactivates the fsaa toggling prior to rendering, which otherwise requires a manual reactivation of the jit.gl.tf.
The default is 0 (no jit.gl.tf support), the fsaa setting is by default on and would otherwise be overriden by tf_support.
Note: Since the fsaa is deprecated and has to be set to jit.world manually by the user, this feature is longer necessary and any jit.gl.tf present in the rendering queue will be natively supported, i.e. it will not have to be re-enabled for rendering.

attribute.name: ae
attribute.digest: Play classic Adobe After Effects sounds after rendering
attribute.description: When set to 1 (default!), will play back the classic Adobe After Effects sound upon rendering completion. However, if DSP was disabled prior to rendering, this setting will not toggle the digital signal processing.

method.name: record
method.description:
Record all audio at the inlets of the.snapshot~, the.jit.poke~, the.mc.jit.catch~, the.mtr or the.mc.sfrecord~ to respective storage formats
Same as sending a 2 integer to first inlet.

method.name: render
method.description:
Based on previously recorded audio and collected data, render video frame-by-frame through an attached jit.world. Everything recorded/collected is being reproduced at framerate at the respective outlets of the.snapshot~, the.mc.snapshot~, the.jit.poke~, the.mc.jit.catch~ or the.mtr in expected formats.
the.jit.mo.drive will control any attached jit.mo.func object's timeline in this mode.
Same as sending a 3 integer to first inlet.

method.name: stop
method.description:
This will stop recording audio (without subsequent export) or rendering video. Any previously written video data will be compiled.
Same as sending a 0 integer to first inlet.

method.name: int
method.description:
0 = halt any through output by children objects to support individual frame query. This mode is toggled automatically when a frame message with an integer specifying a frame is received.
1 = stop any current process and enable jit.world, mostly identical to 0
2 = start recording audio and timed data, same as record
3 = start rendering frame-by-frame, same as render
(reserved)

method.name: open
method.description: All attributes can be set and operations performed in the GUI.

method.name: settings
method.description: Opens the specific window managing the render and recording settings, all of which can be hard-coded or sent as Max messages.

method.name: close
method.description: All attributes can be set and operations performed in the GUI.

method.name: reveal
method.description: If a valid target directory is specified using the dir attribute, the message reveal will open the respective folder. This can be scheduled to happen at upon render completion using the autoreveal attribute.

method.name: length
method.digest: Specify the length of the final video and all its subrecordings
method.description:
The word length followed by a floating point or integer value and a symbol specifying a unit, will prepare recording of all children objects for the given length.
Supported units of time are
ms
frames
samples
Default: length 1000. ms, if the current framerate is set to 30. (see also the fps listing), this would yield a length of 30 frames and would equal the current samplerate (provided in samples per minute = 1000ms.)
The word length without any arguments sets the recording mode to 'free' and will not stop until the stop message is received in the leftmost inlet or toggled in the GUI.
Alternatively, the arguments free and fixed toggle between an assumed performance mode and a fixed time, provided by the respective arguments in a separate message.
Note that a lot of data can ptoentially be accumulated in 'free' recording mode when stretched extensively. This pertains to analysed signals, as well as regular timing data and especially matrix-based anylsis. The latter, however, is currently happening in the.jit.poke~~ where matrices are handled and written to disk in temporary blocks to later populate a jit.matrixset.

method.name: preview
method.description:
Output the corresponding frame at the normalised position while not rendering by jit.world for all children objects.
Note that any accumulative data cannot be reproduced correctly when previewing non-linearly.
This method is not yet supported and may require fundamental recoding as well as documenting.

method.name: frame
method.description:
Output the corresponding frame at the specified position while not rendering by jit.world for all children objects.
This will put the.jit.renderer~ into playback mode '0', to re-enable output by children objects, send a '1' to the leftmost inlet (see the int listing).
Note that any accumulative data cannot be reproduced correctly when previewing non-linearly. The state of any jit_matrix populated by the.jit.poke~~ or the.mc.jit.mnemonic~ will not be overwritten before recalling individual frames and will only be cleared prior to rendering when these objects' autoclear flag is set to '1'.
This method has not yet been thoroughly tested and is subject to user feedback.

method.name: solo
method.digest: Toggle solo mode for children objects
method.description:
According to the numeric argument, will toggle the recording/rendering behaviour of the object with the name provided as argument 1 in relation to other objects in the context
0 = use current active flag if no other object is running @solo 1 or @solo 2, otherwise will set the object to active 0 (bypass)
1 = toggle active operation mode to 1 (operate) along with other objects @solo 1, but not if any object is running @solo 2, in which case it will be muted
2 = unique operation, operate only this object. This will set all other objects' active flag to 5 (mute)
The message solo 0 unsolos all objects and returns them to their set active flag

method.name: unsolo
method.digest: Remove all solo states in children objects
method.description:
The message unsolo does not remove the solo state of the previous object alone but does so for all other objects in the context as well, each of which will assume their set active flag thereafter.
Same as sending the message solo 0

method.name: getstate
method.digest: Query information about current objects in the context
method.description: The message getstate will post relevant status information about every object in the current context to the Max Console and open the latter for viewing. Sending this message to individual objects will do so for the respective ones only. Send this message to monitor which objects will record or render and whether a meaningful name has been allocated to them.

method.name: queue
method.description: The message queue will open a panel managing and monitoring the recording/rendering queue among related instances with their current active flag. These can be changed to taste and temporarily stored in a preset.

method.name: trash
method.digest: Delete all files but the latest ones from disk which have been recorded or rendered
method.description:
The message trash will delete all recorded or rendered files from disk which had previously been written in the current session, except the very last versions written by its related instances. Essentially, it will pruge all unwanted data which may have been written accidentally or in the course of trial-and-error.
If, however, the message trash is followed by any argument, all previous files will be deleted, including the latest one.
This action cannot be undone and no confirmation will be demanded. The respective files are deleted permanently from disk.

method.name: exportattrs
method.digest: Export all current settings to disk
method.description:
Will write a JSON-file containing all current userdata to the directory specified by dir, or will prompt the user to choose a directory.
These settings can be imported with importattrs

method.name: importattrs
method.description:
Will attempt to read a JSON-file containing render settings from the directory specified by dir, or will prompt the user to choose a file.
Current settings can be exported with exportattrs
